cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi ESE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: crossing south-central Florida tonight, then turning northwest across the east-central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast (LA-MS) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Florida coast (near Naples/Ft. Lauderdale area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Jupiter Inlet to north of Ocean Reef (southeast Florida Atlantic coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula (especially south and west coasts), Florida Keys, and later the northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – isolated totals up to 5 inches possible
weather_observation.wind: Low-end tropical storm-force gusts are possible (≤35 kt) with only a 23% chance of sustained 34-kt winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Tampa Bay/Manatee coast with this advisory
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches widespread; pockets of 4–5 inches may cause localized flash flooding and minor river rises around Tampa Bay/Port Manatee
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls reducing visibility and causing short-term berth/gantry crane stoppage; potential lightning activity during heavy convective bands
